p: Although, data about the cytotoxicity of P. abies bark extracts could not be found, a study that analyzed the P. mariana bark hot water extracts did not show any cytotoxic effects on RAW 264.7 macrophages and, even though high levels of phenolic compounds may exert pro-oxidant effects in vitro, due to the overproduction of H 2O 2, quinones, and semiquinones, which might lead to cellular death, these effects are unlikely to happen in vivo, because of the biotransformation of these compounds [ 42, 43].
